This question is too broad. There are so many scenarios to consider. It depends on your starting point, what you want to achieve with the degree, and how much time you have. If you only have a HS degree, then a Bachelor in Math would be very useful. That would be my preference. If you have a bachelors degree that did not include studies in calculus, linear equations and statistics, then it would be helpful to go to a community college to get those courses under your belt. Then apply for a MS in CS. If you have the right background, or after bridging to it, apply for a MS in CS. It also depends on the stage in life you are at. If you have a full time job, the best options maybe an online degree or night classes. The best strategy might be to get the curriculum from a masters degree and then analyze your starting point so you can trace a roadmap to your goal.
